titles.title: 50 States Commemorative Coin Program Act
50 States Commemorative Coin Program Act
To provide for a 10-year circulating commemorative coin program to commemorate each of the 50 States, and for other purposes.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Banking and Financial Services.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Domestic and International Monetary Policy.

committee.name: House Committee on Banking and Financial Services
House Committee on Banking and Financial Services

action.text: Subcommittee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.

committee.name: House Committee on Banking and Financial Services

action.text: Forwarded by Subcommittee to Full Committee (Amended) by Voice Vote.

committee.name: House Committee on Banking and Financial Services

action.text: Mr. Castle moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate.

vote.text: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
Received in the Senate and read twice and referred to the Committee on Banking.

committee.name: Senate Banking, Housing, and Urban Affairs

bill.summary: 9/4/1996--Passed House amended. 50 States Commemorative Coin Program Act - Amends Federal law to: (1) mandate redesign of quarter-dollar coins issued between January 1, 1997, and January 1, 2007, to commemorate each of the 50 States (including any additional State admitted into the Union before the end of such ten-year period); and (2) set fixed, four-year terms for members of the Citizens Commemorative Coin Advisory Committee.
